docs.title: Smart Survey Documentation
docs.text: Welcome! This documentation contains everything you need to use the Smart Survey SDK.

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text: The diagram above shows the complete flow between the Admin Panel, Android SDK, Backend Server, and MongoDB Atlas.

docs.title: 📦 Components
docs.text:
• Library (Android SDK): Display surveys inside Android apps, fetch surveys, and submit responses. Repo: smart-survey-sdk

  • Admin Panel (Web): Create/manage surveys, view responses, and get your API key after signup. Repo: survey-admin-panel

  • Server (Backend): Spring Boot API with JWT (Admin) + API Key auth (SDK), MongoDB Atlas storage. Repo: survey-sdk-server

docs.title: 🛠️ Survey Admin Panel
docs.text:
A React-based admin panel for managing surveys used by the Smart Survey SDK. After registering, each developer receives a personal API Key that is used to initialize the SDK inside their Android app.

🌐 Live Admin Panel: https://survey-admin-panel.onrender.com 🔗 Backend Server (API): https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com

With this panel you can:

  • Create and manage surveys
  • View end-user responses submitted from mobile apps
  • Copy your personal API Key to use in the SDK initialization

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Authentication (JWT-based) Developers must login to access protected pages and send requests to the backend.

  • ✅ Developer Registration + API Key After signing up, the panel displays your personal API Key.

  • ✅ Survey Management (CRUD)

    • Create new surveys
    • Edit existing surveys
    • Delete surveys
    • View all your surveys in a dashboard

  • ✅ Responses Viewer

    • View all responses for a specific survey
    • Search/filter responses (client-side)

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Node.js v22.17.0
  • npm 11.4.2
  • React 19.2.3
  • react-dom 19.2.3
  • react-router-dom 7.12.0
  • react-scripts (CRA) 5.0.1

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Node.js (LTS recommended)
  • npm (comes with Node.js)

docs.title: Install dependencies
docs.text: npm install

docs.title: Configure environment variables
docs.text:
Create a file named .env in the project root:

REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL=https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com

REACT_APP_API_BASE_URL is the base URL of the backend server (the Survey SDK server).

docs.title: Run locally
docs.text:
npm start

The app will be available at:

  • http://localhost:3000

docs.title: Register and get your API Key
docs.text:
1. Open the Admin Panel: https://survey-admin-panel.onrender.com
  2. Go to Create an account
  3. After successful registration, the panel shows your API Key

You will use this API Key inside the Android SDK:

SmartSurvey.init(
    context = applicationContext,
    baseUrl = "https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com/",
    apiKey = "YOUR_API_KEY_FROM_ADMIN_PANEL"
)

docs.title: Login
docs.text:
• Login returns a JWT token
  • The panel stores the JWT in localStorage
  • All admin requests include:
    • Authorization: Bearer <JWT>

docs.title: Main pages (routes)
docs.text: Page Route Description Login / Developer login Register /register Create account + receive API key Dashboard /dashboard View all surveys Create Survey /surveys/new Create a new survey Edit Survey /surveys/:surveyId/edit Update an existing survey Survey Responses /surveys/:surveyId/responses View responses for a survey

docs.title: Survey structure
docs.text:
A survey contains:

  • title
  • questions[]

Each question includes:

  • type (e.g. TEXT, SINGLE_CHOICE)
  • prompt
  • options[] (only for SINGLE_CHOICE)

docs.title: 🧩 API Endpoints Used (Frontend → Backend)
docs.text:
Authentication:

  • POST /api/auth/register
  • POST /api/auth/login

Surveys:

  • GET /api/admin/surveys
  • POST /api/admin/surveys
  • GET /api/admin/surveys/:surveyId
  • PUT /api/admin/surveys/:surveyId
  • DELETE /api/admin/surveys/:surveyId

Responses:

  • GET /api/admin/surveys/:surveyId/responses

docs.title: 🛠️ Technology
docs.text:
• React (Create React App)
  • React Router
  • Fetch API (HTTP requests)
  • JWT Authentication
  • CSS (custom styling)

docs.title: 👨‍💻 Author
docs.text: Developed by Tomer Levy

docs.title: 📋 Smart Survey Library
docs.text:
Smart Survey is an Android library that allows developers to display surveys inside their apps. The SDK can load a survey from a server (by ID or randomly), render it as a UI component, and submit the user's answers back to the server.

This library is designed to be simple to integrate and easy to use inside any Android project.

docs.title: ✨ Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Easy SDK initialization using SmartSurvey.init(...)
  • ✅ Load surveys by ID
  • ✅ Load random surveys
  • ✅ Supports multiple question types:
    • Text input
    • Single choice (radio buttons)
  • ✅ Automatic submission to the server
  • ✅ Callback listener for events

docs.title: Step 1 - Add JitPack repository
docs.text:
In your project root settings.gradle.kts, add JitPack:

dependencyResolutionManagement {
    repositoriesMode.set(RepositoriesMode.FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS)
    repositories {
        google()
        mavenCentral()
        maven("https://jitpack.io")
    }
}

docs.title: Step 2 - Add the dependency
docs.text:
In your app module build.gradle.kts, add:

dependencies {
    implementation("com.github.Tomerlevy104:smart-survey-sdk:v1.0.1")
}

Sync Gradle and wait for the dependency to download.

docs.title: 1. Initialize the SDK
docs.text:
You must initialize the SDK once before using it. The recommended place is Application.onCreate() or inside your first Activity.

SmartSurvey.init(
    context = applicationContext,
    baseUrl = "https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com/",
    apiKey = "YOUR_API_KEY"
)

🔑 API Key: You can get your API key from the Admin Panel after creating an account.

docs.title: 2. Create the SmartSurveyView
docs.text: You can create the survey view in two different ways:

docs.title: Option A: Add the view in XML (static)
docs.text:
Add SmartSurveyView directly to your layout:

<com.seminar.smart_survey_sdk.SmartSurveyView
    android:id="@+id/smartSurveyView"
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="wrap_content" />

Then use it in your Activity/Fragment:

val smartSurveyView = findViewById<SmartSurveyView>(R.id.smartSurveyView)
smartSurveyView.setListener(...)
smartSurveyView.loadRandomSurvey()

docs.title: Option B: Create the view in Kotlin (dynamic / overlay)
docs.text:
This option is useful for overlays, popups, dialogs, or if you want to add/remove the survey dynamically:

val smartSurveyView = SmartSurveyView(this).apply {
    setListener(...)
}

surveyContainer.addView(
    smartSurveyView,
    FrameLayout.LayoutParams(
        FrameLayout.LayoutParams.MATCH_PARENT,
        FrameLayout.LayoutParams.MATCH_PARENT
    )
)

smartSurveyView.loadRandomSurvey()

Both approaches are supported because SmartSurveyView provides constructors for XML inflation and programmatic creation.

docs.title: Option A: Load survey by ID
docs.text: smartSurveyView.loadSurveyById("YOUR_SURVEY_ID")

docs.title: Option B: Load a random survey
docs.text: smartSurveyView.loadRandomSurvey()

docs.title: 4. Listen to survey events
docs.text:
You can register a listener to get callbacks:

smartSurveyView.setListener(object : SmartSurveyListener {

    override fun onSurveyLoaded(surveyId: String) {
        // Survey UI was loaded successfully
    }

    override fun onSurveySubmitted(surveyId: String) {
        // Survey answers were submitted successfully
    }

    override fun onError(error: Throwable) {
        // Any error during loading or submitting
        error.printStackTrace()
    }
})

docs.title: 5. Full example (Activity)
docs.text:
class MainActivity : AppCompatActivity() {

    private lateinit var smartSurveyView: SmartSurveyView

    override fun onCreate(savedInstanceState: Bundle?) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState)
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main)

        // 1) Init SDK
        SmartSurvey.init(
            context = applicationContext,
            baseUrl = "https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com/",
            apiKey = "YOUR_API_KEY"
        )

        // 2) Find view
        smartSurveyView = findViewById(R.id.smartSurveyView)

        // 3) Listener
        smartSurveyView.setListener(object : SmartSurveyListener {
            override fun onSurveyLoaded(surveyId: String) {
                Toast.makeText(this@MainActivity, "Survey loaded: $surveyId", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
            }

            override fun onSurveySubmitted(surveyId: String) {
                Toast.makeText(this@MainActivity, "Survey submitted!", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
            }

            override fun onError(error: Throwable) {
                Toast.makeText(this@MainActivity, "Error: ${error.message}", Toast.LENGTH_SHORT).show()
            }
        })

        // 4) Load survey
        smartSurveyView.loadRandomSurvey()
    }
}

docs.title: 🛠️ Technology
docs.text:
This SDK was built using:

  • Kotlin
  • Material Design Components
  • Retrofit (API requests)
  • OkHttp (HTTP client + Interceptor)

docs.title: 📌 Public API Summary
docs.text:
The main public API for SDK users:

  • SmartSurvey.init(context, baseUrl, apiKey)
  • SmartSurveyView.setListener(listener)
  • SmartSurveyView.loadSurveyById(surveyId)
  • SmartSurveyView.loadRandomSurvey()

docs.title: 🧠 Survey SDK Server
docs.text:
A Spring Boot backend for the Smart Survey SDK and the Survey Admin Panel.

This server is responsible for: - Developer authentication (JWT) for the Admin Panel - API Key authentication for the Android SDK - Survey CRUD operations (create / read / update / delete) - Collecting and storing survey responses from end-users

🌐 Live Server (Render): https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com

docs.title: 🏗️ Architecture
docs.text:
High-level flow:

  • Admin Panel (React) → calls Admin API using JWT (Bearer token)
  • Android SDK → calls SDK API using API Key header: X-API-Key
  • Server → stores data in MongoDB Atlas (cloud)

Project layers (typical request path):

  • Controllers (REST endpoints)
  • Services (business logic)
  • Repositories (MongoDB access)
  • Converters / DTOs (mapping entities ↔ DTOs)

docs.title: 🗄️ Database
docs.text:
• MongoDB Atlas (Cloud)
  • Spring Data MongoDB repositories (MongoRepository)
  • The MongoDB connection string is provided via environment variable:
spring.mongodb.uri=${MONGODB_URI}

docs.title: 🛠️ Tech Stack
docs.text:
• Java 17
  • Spring Boot 4.0.1
  • Spring Web MVC
  • Spring Data MongoDB
  • JWT (jjwt)
  • BCrypt (jbcrypt)
  • OpenAPI / Swagger UI (springdoc)

docs.title: 1) Clone the repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/Tomerlevy104/survey-sdk-server.git
cd survey-sdk-server

docs.title: 2) Set environment variables
docs.text:
You must provide a MongoDB Atlas connection string:

export MONGODB_URI="YOUR_MONGODB_ATLAS_URI"

(Optional) set a custom port (default is 8080): 

export PORT=8080

On Windows PowerShell: 

$env:MONGODB_URI="YOUR_MONGODB_ATLAS_URI"
$env:PORT="8080"

docs.title: 3) Run the server
docs.text:
Using Maven: 

mvn spring-boot:run

Or build + run: 

mvn clean package
java -jar target/*.jar

Server default URL: - http://localhost:8080

docs.title: Admin Panel authentication (JWT)
docs.text:
• Login returns a JWT token.
  • Admin Panel sends the token on each request:
Authorization: Bearer <JWT>

docs.title: SDK authentication (API Key)
docs.text:
• The Android SDK sends an API key on each request:
X-API-Key: <YOUR_API_KEY>
  • The server matches the API key to the correct developer and injects developerId into the request context.

docs.title: ✅ Auth (for Admin Panel)
docs.text: Method Path Description POST /api/auth/register Register a new developer and generate an API Key POST /api/auth/login Login and get a JWT token

docs.title: 🧑‍💼 Admin Panel API (JWT required)
docs.text:
Header: - Authorization: Bearer <JWT>

Method Path Description GET /api/admin/surveys Get all surveys for the logged-in developer GET /api/admin/surveys/{id} Get a single survey by ID (developer-owned) POST /api/admin/surveys Create a new survey PUT /api/admin/surveys/{id} Update an existing survey DELETE /api/admin/surveys/{id} Delete a survey GET /api/admin/surveys/{surveyId}/responses Get all responses for a specific survey

docs.title: 📱 SDK API (API Key required)
docs.text:
Header: - X-API-Key: <YOUR_API_KEY>

Method Path Description GET /api/sdk/surveys/{id} Get a survey by ID GET /api/sdk/surveys/random Get a random survey POST /api/sdk/survey-responses Submit a survey response

docs.title: 🌍 CORS
docs.text:
CORS is configured to allow the Admin Panel and local development server to access the backend.

Allowed origins: - https://survey-admin-panel.onrender.com - http://localhost:3000

docs.title: 📄 API Documentation (Swagger / OpenAPI)
docs.text:
When the server is running, you can use Swagger UI to explore and test endpoints:

  • http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui/index.html
  • (Render) https://survey-sdk-server.onrender.com/swagger-ui/index.html
